justification: “Choice behaviour (how participants allocate their choices between a series of alternatives) is the traditional method of assessing the EE trade-off … These choices are generally examined in multi-armed bandit tasks.”

measured_by: learned predictiveness design eye-tracking (proportion of trial time fixating cues)
justification: “To assess the EE trade-off in attention, the current paper employs a version of the learned predictiveness design … an increased proportion of trial time attending to the predictive cue over the non-predictive cue was interpreted to indicate attentional exploitation, while an increased proportion of trial time attending to cues overall was interpreted to indicate attentional exploration.”
